page.title: 08LAW AND ORDER
page.content: The police station in Thornhill has six policemen - 5 constables and 1 sergeant who work a shift system. They have only one police car but share the patrolling of the area with cars from the police headquarters in Sanquhar. The local force covers the area between Enterkinfoot in the north, Auldgirth in the south, Moniaive in the west and Strathclyde border in the east. Crime in the area was described as "mainly petty" with occasional "break-ins" and the odd "drunken brawl". Criminals are taken, after charging, to the cells at Thornhill where there is no overnight accommodation. Prisoners requiring to be detained are taken to Dumfries to be dealt with.
